data.Sentence_cn: 课文18  海豚
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 18 Porpoises

data.Sentence_cn: 你认为江豚的主要特征是什么?
data.Sentence: What would you say is the main characteristic of porpoises?

data.Sentence_cn: 长期以来，海员中流传着一种迷信的说法，认为海豚会把快要淹死的人托到水面，救人性命；
data.Sentence: There has long been a superstition among mariners that porpoises will save drowning men by pushing them to the surface,

data.Sentence_cn: 或在人们周围列队保护，使他们免遭鲨鱼伤害。
data.Sentence: or protect them from sharks by surrounding them in defensive formation.

data.Sentence_cn: 海洋摄影室的生物学家指出，无论海豚多么聪明，
data.Sentence: Marine Studio biologists have pointed out that, however intelligent they may be,

data.Sentence_cn: 认为它们有救人的动机可能是错误的。
data.Sentence: it is probably a mistake to credit dolphins with any motive of life-saving.

data.Sentence_cn: 当它们偶尔把一个失去知觉的人推到岸边时，更大的可能是出于好奇或游戏，
data.Sentence: On the occasions when they have pushed to shore an unconscious human being they have much more likely done it out of curiosity or for sport,

data.Sentence_cn: 就像它们追逐被船首犁开的浪花一样。
data.Sentence: as in riding the bow waves of a ship.

data.Sentence_cn: 1928年，有人拍摄到了海豚像海狸一样把浸透水的床垫推上岸的情景。
data.Sentence: In 1928 some porpoises were photographed working like beavers to push ashore a waterlogged mattress.

data.Sentence_cn: 正如报道中所说，如果海豚保护人不受鲨鱼侵害，
data.Sentence: If, as has been reported, they have protected humans from sharks,

data.Sentence_cn: 那么它们可能是出于好奇；而鲨鱼可能是闻到了可以美食一顿的香味。
data.Sentence: it may have been because curiosity attracted them and because the scent of a possible meal attracted the sharks.

data.Sentence_cn: 海豚和鲨鱼是天然仇敌，
data.Sentence: Porpoises and sharks are natural enemies.

data.Sentence_cn: 双方可能随之发生搏斗，搏斗结果是海豚赶走或咬死鲨鱼。
data.Sentence: It is possible that upon such an occasion a battle ensued, with the sharks being driven away or killed.

data.Sentence_cn: 海豚对凡是活的东西都感兴趣，不管是鸟、是鱼，还是野兽。
data.Sentence: Whether it be bird, fish or beast, the porpoise is intrigued with anything that is alive.

data.Sentence_cn: 它们经常追逐海龟，海龟则温顺地忍受着各种侮辱。
data.Sentence: They are constantly after the turtles, who peacefully submit to all sorts of indignities.

data.Sentence_cn: 一只小海豚特别喜欢用鼻子把海龟推到水面，
data.Sentence: One young calf especially enjoyed raising a turtle to the surface with his snout,

data.Sentence_cn: 然后像滑水板一样把海龟从水池的这一边推到那一边。
data.Sentence: and then shoving him across the tank like an aquaplane.

data.Sentence_cn: 几乎每天都可以看到一只小海豚把鼻子顶入一只300磅重的海龟的硬壳下面，拼命地把它翻过来。
data.Sentence: Almost any day a young porpoises may be seen trying to turn a 300-pound sea turtle over by sticking his snout under the edge of his shell and pushing up for dear life.

data.Sentence_cn: 这并非易事，可能需要两只海豚合伙干才行。
data.Sentence: This is not easy, and may require two porpoises working together.

data.Sentence_cn: 在另一场游戏中，当海龟游过水族馆时，第一只海豚从上方猛扑下去，用腹部撞击龟壳。
data.Sentence: In another game, as the turtle swims across the oceanarium, the first porpoise swoops down from above and butts his shell with his belly.

data.Sentence_cn: 这一下子把海龟撞下去好几英尺。
data.Sentence: This knocks the turtle down several feet.

data.Sentence_cn: 海龟刚恢复平衡，第二只海豚又冲过来猛击一下。
data.Sentence: He no sooner recovers his equilibrium than the next porpoises comes along and hits him another crack.

data.Sentence_cn: 这只海龟最终被撞到池底。
data.Sentence: Eventually the turtle has been butted all the way down to the floor of the tank.

data.Sentence_cn: 此时的海龟，只要能站起来就满足了，但它刚站起来，就被一只海豚击倒。
data.Sentence: He is now satisfied merely to try to stand up, but as soon as he does so a porpoise knocks him flat.

data.Sentence_cn: 海龟终于屈服了，将4条腿缩进壳内。游戏到此结束。
data.Sentence: The turtle at last gives up by pulling his feet under his shell and the game is over.
